alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Grafton; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 3:23PM EDT until June 28 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL BELKNAP, CENTRAL MERRIMACK AND SOUTHERN GRAFTON COUNTIES... At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rain has let up over the area with additional light rainfall rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area through 5 PM. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 93 between mile markers 47 and 69. Interstate 89 between mile markers 15 and 19. A second round of heavy rain is possible this evening. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
